title: Data Sets for Practical Data Analysis
text: Data sets featuring data precip_temp_DWD: temperature precipitation Germany, csv ames_de_train: Ames housing train set, shortened version, csv ames_de_test: Ames housind test set, shortened version, csv elec_results: German elections 2017, csv wellbeing: OECD wellbeing 2016, csv extra: survey extraversion 2015-2016, csv cult_values: Schwartz cultural values 1988-2000, csv socec: sociol economic data German 2017 electoral districts, csv wahlkreise_shp: geomap German electoral districts 2017, shape-file wo_men: toy data set sex, height, shoe size, differences women men, csv dating: online dating platform experiment 2015, csv germanlex: German sentiment lexicon, csv sentiws: German sentiment lexicon, csv stats_test: predictors score statistics test, csv countries: names world countries, csv afd: party platform AfD party 2016 (“Alternative fuer Deutschland”), csv afd_2022: party platform AfD party 2022 (“Alternative fuer Deutschland”), csv schimpfwoerter: List profane words (Schimpfwörter) German csv offensive: List potentially offensive short texts German csv wild_emojis: Several emojis frequently used express discontent hate csv corr_data: Simulated correlation data csv germeval_train germeval_test: short text snippets similar tweets hate-speech classification based GermEval2018 data train csv, test-csv Notes () data sets published author package. original authors respective licences can found desription data set.

what: Schwartz Cultural Value Orientation Scores for 80 countries — cult_values
title: Schwartz Cultural Value Orientation Scores for 80 countries — cult_values
text: Data based Schwartz' theory cultural values. following description taken http://latest-schwartz.wikidot.com/ (CC--SA 3.0). Data collected 1988 2000. 7 cultural dimensions Schwartz theory:harmony, embeddedness, hierarchy, mastery, affective autonomy, intellectual autonomy, egalitarianism. Embeddedness VS Autonomy:Embeddedness appears situations individuals embedded collectivity find meaning social relationships,identifying group,participating shared way life,striving toward shared goals.embeddedness societies personal interests seen different group high value placed preserving status quo avoiding individual actions attitudes might undermine traditional order things.Important values societies social order,respect tradition,security,obedience wisedom.autonomy refers situation individuals viewed autonomous.bounded entities expected cultivate express preferences,feelings,ideas,abilities find meaning uniqueness.Autonomy broken two categories:intellectual autonomy refers independent prusuit ideas ,intellectual derections rights;affective autonomy,refers independent pursuit affectively positive experiences varied life,pleasure enjoyment life. Hierarchy VS Egalitarianism:hierarchical societies individuals resources associated society organized hierarchically individuals within societies socialized comply roles assigned hierarchy subjected sanctions fail comply.Modesty self-control values associated hierarchy.egalitarian societies individuals seen moral equals everyone shares basic interests human beings.egalitarian societies people socialized internalize commitment cooperate feel concern everyone's welfare.Valued associated egalitarian societies include socail justice caring weaker members society,honesty,equality,sympathy working good others,social responsibility voluntary cooperation pursuit well-prosperity others within society. Mastery VS Harmony:Mastery refers situation wher individuals value succeeding getting ahead self-assertion proactively seek master,direct change natural social world advance personal interests interests groups belong.Specific values associated mastery include independence,fearlessness daring,ambition hard work,drive success competence.Harmony refers situation wher individuals content accept fit natural social world find seek understand,preserve protect rather change,direct exploit .Important values societies harmony valued include world peace,unity nature,protecting environment. conclusions Schwartz theory:cultural value orientations can inferred form mean values individuals societies;world composed cultural regions,linked history,geography,economics,religion;knowing cultures differ gives tools specific analysis issuses international contact;cultural value orientations relate reciprocal causaltiy key social structural,political,demographic features society.  items collected -1 +7 response scale.   Note: Three lines added (countries: can, ger, swi), values computed (unweighted) average country parts.

title: Schwartz Cultural Value Orientation Scores for 80 countries — cult_values
Schwartz Cultural Value Orientation Scores for 80 countries — cult_values
text: data frame 83 rows 10 variables: country short country name, short form country_long country name, long form harmony Unity Nature World Peace embedded Social Order, Obedience Respect Tradition hierarchy Authority Humble mastery Ambition Daring aff_auton affective autonomy; Pleasure intel_auton intellectual autonomy; Broadmindedness Curiosity egalitar egalitarianism; Social Justice Equality

title: Schwartz Cultural Value Orientation Scores for 80 countries — cult_values

what: Results from an experiment on status symbols an dating success — dating
title: Results from an experiment on status symbols an dating success — dating
text: Data online dating/mating app experiment IV "car status symbol" (yes vs. ) DV1 "matching" (number) DV2 "message sent" (number). principal research question whether luxury sports car (BMW Z4) individual profile portrait photo online dating app influence number contact requests messages sent profile. Care taken profiles showed difference besides car.

Username anonymized comm_type Type communication individuals: either matching contact message whr Numeric. Waist hip ratio strawperson beauty Subjective beauty rating strawperson rating committee

what: Results from a survey on extraversion — extra
title: Results from a survey on extraversion — extra
text: dataset provides results survey extraversion. Subjects students participating statistics class FOM University Applied Sciences. Student different majors participated study majority coming psychology majors. study intented primarily educational endavor. example, variables different scale levels (nominal, metric) included. However, different aspect extraverion included test psychometric assumptions. example, one item approaches extraversion included.

title: German sentiment lexicon — germanlex
German sentiment lexicon — germanlex
text: data frame containing 8856 rows 4 columns word Chr. German word qualifier Chr. Either "NEG" negative, "POD" positive, "NEU" neutral, "SHI" shifter (derbs enhance sentiment eg., horribly wrong, really good), "INT" intensifier, INT<1 reduction factor, INT>1 gain factor polarity_strength num. Strength polarity pos Position Sentence, "type word" grammatical phrase

title: German sentiment lexicon — germanlex
text: Fahrni, Angela, Manfred Klenner. "Old wine warm beer: Target-specific sentiment analysis adjectives." Proc. Symposium Affective Language Human Machine, AISB. 2008. Clematide, Simon, Manfred Klenner. "Evaluation extension polarity lexicon German." Proceedings First Workshop Computational Approaches Subjectivity Sentiment Analysis. 2010.

title: Sentiment dictionary
text: SentimentWortschatz, SentiWS short, publicly available German-language resource sentiment analysis, opinion mining etc. lists positive negative polarity bearing words weighted within interval [-1; 1] plus part speech tag, applicable, inflections. current version SentiWS contains 1,650 positive 1,818 negative words, sum 15,649 positive 15,632 negative word forms incl. inflections, respectively. contains adjectives adverbs explicitly expressing sentiment, also nouns verbs implicitly containing one.

title: Sentiment dictionary
Sentiment dictionary
text: data frame containing 3468 rows 4 variables neg_pos Chr. Whether polarity negative positive word Chr. Name word value Num. Sentiment value inflections Chr. Inflections

title: Sentiment dictionary
text: R. Remus, U. Quasthoff & G. Heyer: SentiWS - Publicly Available German-language Resource Sentiment Analysis. : Proceedings 7th International Language Ressources Evaluation (LREC'10), pp. 1168-1171, 2010, see http://wortschatz.uni-leipzig.de/en/download/

what: Results from an exam in inferential statistics. — stats_test
title: Results from an exam in inferential statistics. — stats_test
text: dataset provides results text exam inferential statistics. Subjects mostly inscribed psychology class. BSc MSc. students participated test. Participation voluntarily. real grading performed. Data collected 2015 2017. exam consisted 40 binary items. item formulated statement either correct false. Students tick response online form. addition question asked preparation time, upfront self-evalution interest

title: Results from an exam in inferential statistics. — stats_test
Results from an exam in inferential statistics. — stats_test
text: data frame containing 2263 rows 7 columns row_number Integer. Row number date_time Chr. Date Time German format bestanden (Chr. Whether student passed ("ja") passed ("nein") exam study_time Int. Subjective rating study time, ranging 1 (low) 5 (high) self_eval Int. Subjective upfront rating expected success, ranging fom 1 (low) 10 (high) interest Int. Subjective upfront rating interest statistics, ranging fom 1 (low) 6 (high) score Int. score (number correct answers 40), ranging fom 0 (false) 40 (correct)
